data.title: Luke Pettit appointed as head of US Treasury‚Äôs banking policy, involving digital asset firms
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News The Trump administration has appointed Luke Pettit, an assistant to Republican Senator Bill Hagerty, to a senior position in the U.S. Treasury Department. According to a notice on Congress.gov, Pettit has been nominated as Assistant Secretary of Financial Institutions. Pettit will be in charge of the Treasury Department's department office, which plays an important role in formulating policies to regulate banks, fintech companies (including digital asset companies), non-bank mortgage institutions and many other financial companies. The position requires Senate approval.
Pettit has served as a senior policy adviser to Hagerty, a Republican from Tennessee, for the past three years. According to his LinkedIn profile, before that, he was an economist on the Senate Banking Committee and served at Bridgewater Fund, the Monetary Affairs Department of the Federal Reserve Bank of Washington, and the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco.
He will replace Graham Steele, who held the position during the Biden administration. Steele left the Treasury Department in January 2024.
Ethan Fallang, a former Rumble Inc. board member and prot√©g√© of Vice President JD Vance, has also been appointed to a senior position in the Treasury Department's Office of Financial Institutions. Fallang was a top candidate for the position of deputy assistant secretary for capital markets, according to people familiar with the matter, but it is unclear whether he has accepted the position. (Bloomberg)

data.title: President Trump‚Äôs Crypto Czar Hosts U.S.‚Äôs First Press Conference On Bitcoin And Digital Assets
data.description:
David Sacks and several pro-crypto politicians discuss the future of the Bitcoin and crypto industry in the United States at the first-ever U.S. press conference on digital assets.
source: https://bitcoinmagazine.com/politics/president-trumps-crypto-czar-hosts-first-press-conference-on-bitcoin-and-digital-assets

data.title: SEC is scaling back its crypto enforcement unit: Report
data.description:
The SEC‚Äôs 50-person crypto unit is getting a shakeup with some staff reassigned to other areas, The New York Times reports.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/sec-scale-back-crypto-enforcement-unit-nyt?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: Ohio Senator Proposes Building Bitcoin Reserve and Accepting It as Payment
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: Ohio Senator Sandra O'Brien introduced a bill proposing to establish a Bitcoin reserve and require state entities to accept Bitcoin as a payment method.

data.title: Ohio Senator Proposes Bill for Bitcoin Reserves and Payments
data.description: According to Odaily, Ohio State Senator Sandra O'Brien has introduced a bill proposing the establishment of a Bitcoin reserve and mandating state entities to accept Bitcoin as a form of payment. This legislative move aims to integrate cryptocurrency into the state's financial system, reflecting a growing interest in digital currencies.

data.title: Meet the US Congressman Who's Now Repping Ethereum on His X Profile
data.description:
Rep. William Timmons said that he created a self-custodial Ethereum wallet to gain familiarity with technology enabling financial sovereignty.
source: https://decrypt.co/304425/meet-us-congressman-repping-ethereum-x-profile

data.description: According to BlockBeats, on February 5, blockchain data revealed that Circle has issued an additional 250 million USDC on the Solana blockchain two hours ago.

data.title: WazirX creditors to decide on recovery plan or risk lengthy liquidation
data.description:
WazirX creditors will decide in the coming weeks whether to begin receiving compensation for their lost crypto as early as April 2025 or face a prolonged recovery process that could extend to 2030. The vote follows a Singapore High Court ruling allowing the embattled Indian exchange to pursue a restructuring plan rather than face liquidation.¬†The [‚Ä¶]
